html: (2 Nephi 14:2)."The branch of the Lord [shall] be beautiful and glorious." The word "branch" in Hebrew was symbolic of the Messiah. The Branch is the Messiah, even Jesus Christ, He whose "glory def[ies] all description." (JS H 1:17; see also Jeremiah 23:5-6.) In another sense, the "branch" could represent dispersed remnants of the house of Israel who have been redeemed and brought back to the glory of the Lord. (See Isaiah 60:21; 61:3; 2 Nephi 3:5; Jacob 2:25.)
